doc.previous: The origin of this form is to be found in John von Neumann and Oskar Morgenstern s book when looking at these instances they guessed that when a union appears it works against the fraction as if two individuals were playing a normal game The balanced payoff of C is a basic function Although there are differing examples that help determine coalitional amounts from normal games not all appear that in their function form can be derived from such
doc.after: Such characteristic functions have expanded to describe games where there is no removable utility
